question.title: What Row class is returned when Apache Beam BigtableIO is used?
question.body:
The below code snippet using BigtableIO returns com.google.bigtable.v2.Row whereas com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.models.Row is more user friendly that is being used in other bigtable java clients

PCollection<Row> rows =
      pipeline.apply("read Row", BigtableIO.read()
        .withProjectId(projectId)
        .withInstanceId(instanceId)
        .withTableId(bigTableId)
        .withEmulator("localhost:8086"))

How do I convert PCollection<com.google.bigtable.v2.Row> to PCollection<com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.models.Row>?

Or

Is it recommended to write beam pipelines with com.google.bigtable.v2.Row instead of com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.models.Row?

answers.body:
I haven’t found any documentation supporting the conversion between the two. As far as I know, BigtableIO only supports com.google.bigtable.v2.Row.

Have you also seen this Bigtable Beam connector (BigtableIO) documentation? It mentions that the Bigtable Beam connector (BigtableIO) works alongside the Bigtable Java client library to interact with Google Cloud Bigtable. BigtableIO is an Apache Beam I/O connector for Bigtable and is part of the Apache Beam SDK. Wherein, the Bigtable Java client library is used to make direct API calls to Bigtable from your java applications.

If you're working with BigtableIO methods, you'll be dealing with com.google.bigtable.v2.Row class in Beam pipelines to interact with Bigtable. On the other hand, if you're directly using Bigtable’s Java client library for your Java applications, you'll be dealing with com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.models.Row instead.

79612600.body: Thanks @HerPat . I am new to apache beam. So I was trying to determine whether I should continue using com.google.bigtable.v2.Row instead of com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.models.Row in beam pipelines. It looks like the answer is yes.
